alert.note: Alert for Bulloch (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 30 at 7:46PM EST until December 30 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EST FOR PORTIONS OF BULLOCH COUNTY... At 746 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Register, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include: Statesboro, Brooklet, Register, Leefield, Stilson and Georgia Southern. This warning includes I-16 between mile markers 113 and 114. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
